newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines extends ceasefire with rebels.
newsitem.headline: Philippines extends ceasefire with rebels.

text.p: The Philippines has extended for another 30 days a unilateral ceasefire with communist rebels to help peace talks which are resuming this week in the Netherlands, the government said on Sunday.
Defence Secretary Renato de Villa said the extension was part of "confidence-builidng measures" to help ensure the success of the talks aimed at ending a 28-year insurgency .

The talks between the government and the communist-led National Democratic Front (NDF) are to resume on Tuesday in the Dutch city of Utrecht, officials said. Many NDF leaders live in exile in the Netherlands.
Manila first declared a 60-day ceasefire last December and extended it for another 30 days last month.
President Fidel Ramos has said the government may be able to finish the talks with the NDF by June.
More than 40,000 people have died in the insurgency.

Ramos has concluded separate peace deals with the Moro National Liberation Front (MNLF), ending a 24-year Moslem revolt for autonomy in the southern Philippines, and with right-wing army rebels linked to six failed coup attempts from 1986 to 1989.
The government is also holding exploratory talks with another Moslem rebel faction, the Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF), which is fighting for an Islamic state in the southern islands.
